intro: Cochlearia rusticana, commonly known as the rock scurvygrass, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing habit, with basal leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in early spring. It is typically found in rocky or coastal environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Cochlearia rusticana is adapted to harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
